mn127:2.6: BB has “puntually, but pageva usually means” how much more so', and here it also has tara.
mn127:2.7: This whole passage, with Pancakanga addressing a man in the way of nobility, inviting a specific senior monk for a luxury spread, and working for the king, shows that “carpenter” is really quite inadequate. The root is stha-pati, i.e. master-builder.
mn127:13.5: BB has “By reason of the factor [responsible for rebirth]” for tadangena, but it is an idiom that appears in AN 9.33 without causal implication. If the answer was in terms of cause, the next question would not be necessary.
